019package com.plotsquared.core.permissions;
020
021import com.plotsquared.core.configuration.Settings;
022import org.checkerframework.checker.index.qual.NonNegative;
023import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.NonNull;
024import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.Nullable;
025
026/**
027 * Any object which can hold permissions
028 */
029public interface PermissionHolder {
030
031    /**
032     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given (global) permission
033     *
034     * @param permission Permission
035     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
036     */
037    default boolean hasPermission(final @NonNull String permission) {
038        return hasPermission(null, permission);
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given (global) keyed permission. Checks both {@code permission.key}
043     * and {@code permission.*}
044     *
045     * @param permission Permission
046     * @param key        Permission "key"
047     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
048     * @since 6.0.10
049     */
050    default boolean hasKeyedPermission(
051            final @NonNull String permission,
052            final @NonNull String key
053    ) {
054        return hasKeyedPermission(null, permission, key);
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Check the highest permission a PlotPlayer has within a specified range.<br>
059     * - Excessively high values will lag<br>
060     * - The default range that is checked is {@link Settings.Limit#MAX_PLOTS}<br>
061     *
062     * @param stub  The permission stub to check e.g. for `plots.plot.#` the stub is `plots.plot`
063     * @param range The range to check
064     * @return The highest permission they have within that range
065     */
066    @NonNegative
067    default int hasPermissionRange(
068            final @NonNull String stub,
069            @NonNegative final int range
070    ) {
071        if (hasPermission(Permission.PERMISSION_ADMIN.toString())) {
072            return Integer.MAX_VALUE;
073        }
074        String[] nodes = stub.split("\\.");
075        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
076        for (int i = 0; i < (nodes.length - 1); i++) {
077            builder.append(nodes[i]).append(".");
078            if (!stub.equals(builder + Permission.PERMISSION_STAR.toString())) {
079                if (hasPermission(builder + Permission.PERMISSION_STAR.toString())) {
080                    return Integer.MAX_VALUE;
081                }
082            }
083        }
084        if (hasPermission(stub + ".*")) {
085            return Integer.MAX_VALUE;
086        }
087        for (int i = range; i > 0; i--) {
088            if (hasPermission(stub + "." + i)) {
089                return i;
090            }
091        }
092        return 0;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given permission
097     *
098     * @param world      World name
099     * @param permission Permission
100     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
101     */
102    boolean hasPermission(@Nullable String world, @NonNull String permission);
103
104    /**
105     * Check if the owner of the profile has a given keyed permission. Checks both {@code permission.key}
106     * and {@code permission.*}
107     *
108     * @param world      World name
109     * @param permission Permission
110     * @param key        Permission "key"
111     * @return {@code true} if the owner has the given permission, else {@code false}
112     * @since 6.0.10
113     */
114    boolean hasKeyedPermission(@Nullable String world, @NonNull String permission, @NonNull String key);
115
116}
